item.name: +1 All-Purpose Tool
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|PHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you are proficient with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +1 bonus to the spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your artificer spells.

As an action, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Clean Up
entries: You keep your weapon extremely clean on the daily.
Damage rolls with your weapon gain +1 Damage.

item.name: Redistributing Weight
entries: You redistribute the weight of your weapon to make it more handleable.
Attack rolls with your weapon gain +1 to hit.

item.name: Loosen the Trigger - (Ranged Weapons Only)
entries: You loosen the trigger of your firearm, making it more responsive for firing on reaction.
Attack rolls with your weapon gain +2 to hit when you use your Hold Action to attack.

item.name: Sanding - (Melee Weapons Only)
entries: You sand your weapon on the daily to keep it as sharp as it can be, making it better at cutting through armor.
Your weapon gains +3 DR penetration.

item.name: Improvised Silencer - (Guns Only)
entries:
You add an improvised silencer to the barrel of your weapon, making it a lot quiter when you shoot with it.
This effects all gun types that aren't based on energenetic damage, but works the best on pressure based guns.

item.name: Hoverboard
entries:
A small hovering vehicle, which can be used like a skateboard from the olden days.
You can use half a day of practice to learn how to use this item, and an extra two full days of practice to gain proficiency.

While using the hoverboard your movement speed becomes 8 meters, or double that when proficient.
You gain disadvantage on Dexterity Saving Throws, Dexterity based Skill Checks and Attack Rolls if you are riding the hoverboard while you aren't proficient in using it.
The hoverboard can hover over solid ground at a hight of 25 cm, and it cannot hover over liquids deeper than half a meter. It can hold a maximum of 250 kg.

entries.name: Overdrive [X MP]
entries:
You can overdrive the hoverboard to make it perform better.
For every point of maintenance you use on this item, it gains 2 meter movement, can fly an extra 25 cm higher, and can hold 25 kg more.

item.name: SMG
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Shotgun
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: LMG
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Coil SMG
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Coil Shotgun
entries: +3 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Slugger
entries:
-1 to Hit Bonus
Ignores all flat DR.
Does double damage against objects.

A large shotgun-like firearm which fires large slugs of around 5 cm long and 3 cm in diameter at very high velocities.

item.name: Coil LMG
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser Pistol
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser Assault Rifle
entries: +1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser Shotgun
entries: +5 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser Hunting Rifle
entries: +2 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser Sniper Rifle
entries: +3 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Laser LMG
entries:
+2 to Hit Bonus

Basically a bulky and cheaply made Pulse Laser.

item.name: Plasma SMG
entries: -1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Plasma Shotgun
entries: +2 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Plasma LMG
entries: -2 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Zweihander
entries: -1 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Waraxe
entries: -2 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Warhammer
entries: -3 to Hit Bonus

item.name: Chainsaw
entries:
-1 to Hit Bonus
-1 Meter Speed when wielded

item.name: Leather Armor
entries: Leather armor. Not the best protection, more stylish than anything else as it can be made into normal clothing like a jacket.

item.name: Lexar Armor
entries:
A cheap but lightweight armor made of a polymer blend called Lexar™.
It restricts your movement a bit, but also offers a slight amount of protection.

item.name: Kevlar Armor
entries:
A Kevlar vest, made of the polymer kevlar.
It restrictis your movement a bit, but also offers some protection.

item.name: Dyneema Armor
entries:
A piece of armor made of UHMWPE fibres. Also goes by it's trivial name: Dyneema Armor.
It doesn't restrict movement, and gives a small but noticable amount of protection as well.

item.name: Stealth Armor
entries: You gain advantage on Stealth Checks.

item.name: Woven Iron Armor
entries: This armor can be woven into normal clothes, making it not noticable as an armor.

item.name: Woven Aluminium Armor
entries: This armor can be woven into normal clothes, making it not noticable as an armor.

item.name: Osplir Armor
entries:
This armor gives you resistance to acid damage.

Osplir Armor, made from an alloy of Osmium, Platinum and Iridium.

item.name: Fullsteel Armor
entries: *not actually made of steel.

item.name: F10P Armor
entries: This armor gives you resistance to piercing & slashing damage.

item.name: F10B Armor
entries: This armor gives you resistance to bludgeoning, explosion & fall damage.

item.name: Light Power Armor
entries:
-1 on Dexterity Score while wearing this.
This armor weighs 14 kg when you carry it, but wearing it lowers the strain to about 10 kg of carry weight.

item.name: Heavy Power Armor
entries:
-2 on Dexterity Score while wearing this.
This armor weighs 26 kg when you carry it, but wearing it lowers the strain to about 8 kg of carry weight.
This armor gives you resistance to: piercing, slashing, bludgeoning, explosion & fall damage.

item.name: Oxwall Shield
entries:
-1 on Constitution Modifier while using this.
This armor gives you resistance to: piercing, slashing, bludgeoning, explosion & fall damage.

item.name: Standard Shield (Kinetic)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against bludgeoning & explosion damage.

item.name: Standard Shield (Energy)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against laser, plasma, cold plasma, electric, cold, heat damage and fire damage.

item.name: Standard Shield (Energenetics)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against energenetic damage.

item.name: Heavy Shield (Kinetic)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against bludgeoning & explosion damage.

item.name: Heavy Shield (Energy)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against laser, plasma, cold plasma, electric, cold, heat damage and fire damage.

item.name: Heavy Shield (Energenetics)
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against energenetic damage.

item.name: PSC Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against laser, plasma, cold plasma, electric, cold, heat damage and fire damage.

item.name: OPSC Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against laser, plasma, cold plasma, electric, cold, heat damage and fire damage.

item.name: SP-CRAIKS Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against explosion damage.

item.name: ECM V0.8 Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against energenetic damage.

item.name: ECM V1.0 Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against energenetic damage.

item.name: ECM V2.0 Shield
entries: You gain this shields DR bonus against energenetic damage.

item.name: Antimatter Grenade
entries: 1 turn cooking time

item.name: Flashbang
entries: All affected creatures get -3 and Disadvantage on Dexterity Saving Throws and Attack Rolls, and have halved speed until the start of their next turn.

item.name: Smoke Grenade
entries:
2 turns cooking time
Releases smoke, obscuring anything that is within or behind it. This smoke gives full cover without the DR bonus, meaning it gives +6 AC.

item.name: Small Caltrop
entries:
A big inconspicuous spike that is quite horrible to step in.
You cannot use it as caltrops effectively when you have only one, as you need 20 caltrops to use them effectively.

item.name: Small Caltrops (bag of 20)
entries:
Big inconspicuous spikes that are quite horrible to step in.
A single set can cover an circular area of 1 meter radius.
When someone moves over the ground into or through this space with them knowing the caltrops are there, than they need to make a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a fail, they take {@damage 2d4+2} piercing damage and canâ€™t be damaged again by this set of caltrops.
Someone who steps into an area of caltrops without knowing they were there fails the Dexterity Saving Throw automatically.

item.name: Rope (1m)
entries: 1 Meter of hemp or silk rope. Can hold weight up to 500 Kg. Has an AC of 6, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't bludgeoning, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage.

item.name: Rope (180m)
entries: The maximum length of commercially sold hemp or silk rope. Can hold weight up to 500 Kg. Has an AC of 6, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't bludgeoning, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage.

item.name: Steel Cable (1m)
entries: 1 Meter of steel cable, which can also be used like rope, although it is difficult to use for grip when climbing. Can hold weight up to 1 tonne. Has an AC of 7, DR of 10, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't fire, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage. Using this to climb will give disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws for climbing it as it is quite slippery.

item.name: Steel Cable (80m)
entries: The maximum length of commercially sold steel cable, which can also be used like rope, although it is difficult to use for grip when climbing. Can hold weight up to 1 tonne. Has an AC of 7, DR of 10, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't fire, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage.  Using this to climb will give disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws for climbing it as it is quite slippery.

item.name: Carbon Cable (1m)
entries: 1 Meter of Carbonfibre cable, which can also be used like rope. Can hold weight up to 50 tonnes. Has an AC of 6, DR of 8, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't bludgeoning, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage.

item.name: Carbon Cable (360m)
entries: The maximum length of commercially sold Carbonfibre cable, which can also be used like rope. Can hold weight up to 50 tonnes. Has an AC of 6, DR of 8, and will break when it takes any damage that isn't bludgeoning, fall, knockout, electromagnetic or consitution based damage.

item.name: Mobile Compact Personal Computer
entries:
A very small personal computer, small enough to take with you. Often used to communicate with others over long distances or to search the NoodleSoup for information.
Depending on the type and brand, they range from having a physical keyboard and mouse, to touchscreen, to 3D holographic projected screens whether monochromatic or in colour.
The given value and weight are also just estimations, as most of them are overpriced, and the costs heavily depend on the features the product has and the brand that made the product.

item.name: Bracetop
entries: A {@item Mobile Compact Personal Computer|CDPH} in a bracelet, usually word around the wrist.

item.name: Medkit
entries: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

item.name: Personal Medkit
entries: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

itemGroup.name: Pressure Based Guns
entries: A gun that uses a pressure based fireing system, usually by exploading a small amount of explosive inside the used ammunition to propell said ammunition foreward. Most give a loud *Bang* when shot.

itemGroup.name: Laser Based Guns
entries: A gun that uses high capacity powerbanks to fire a very strong laser for a brief moment. Usually giving a very quiet electrical current *Wirr* when shot.

itemGroup.name: Coil Based Guns
entries: A gun that uses magnetic or ferromagnetic based ammunition, and fires it by using strong electromagnetic coils. Usually giving a well noticable electrical current *Wirr* when shot.

itemGroup.name: Plasma Based Guns
entries: A gun that uses special high pressure gascans and high capacity powerbanks as ammunition, being able to fire white-blue-ish plasma at a high velocity.  Usually giving a well noticable electrical current *Wirr* and *Zoowm* when shot.
